newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real dips 0.01 pct in speculative trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real dips 0.01 pct in speculative trade.

text.p: Brazil's real closed down 0.01 percent at 1.0247 per greenback in speculative trading on the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
Banks speculated early in the day over a possible large dollar outflow, which pushed the local currency down to 1.0254 per dollar in morning trade.

The real recovered some ground as net dollar flows pointed to only a small deficit. Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Wednesday deficit of $15 million, dealers said.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real ended at 1.0305 per dollar, down 0.03 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real fell 0.95 percent to close at 1.060 per greenback.

The real's fall in the black market was caused by a strong reduction in the supply of dollars. Players buying dollars to cover their short positions also helped to drop the local currency, traders said.
